intro: Apluda, commonly known as the desert lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and tall, erect flowering stems that bear clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. Apluda species are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in their thick leaves and stems. They are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
